revised_title: Strong-Coupling Asymptotic Expansions in the Complex Nikitin Model of Atomic Collisions
tldr: The authors investigate the two-state, three-parameter exponential Nikitin model of atomic collisions, which involves complex energies and complex interactions. They apply strong-coupling asymptotic expansions to the model and obtain the adiabatic semi-classical scattering matrix, which describes non-adiabatic transitions between quasi-stationary states. The authors also discuss the Berry phase interpretation of the model and show that it reduces to known limiting cases, such as the Demkov, Rosen-Zener, and parabolic models.
